answers.answer: Hi,It is important to know what all tests have you undergone. Your symptoms could be due to migraine, thyroid dysfunction, uncontrolled high BP, TIA or stroke, fibromyalgia or chronic fatigue syndrome.A complete clinical and neurological exam is warranted. It is also important to undergo a MRI of brain to rule out neurological lesions.Hope this helps!

question: I am a 19 year old female. I have daily severe headaches. I also have extreme fatigue, dizziness, double vision, and nausea(sometimes vomiting). I have seen lots of doctors, and had lots of testing, with no answers. It has become very debilitating to me to the point that I had to quit college because I couldn't keep up. My other health issues include diabetes, high blood pressure, polycystic ovarian disease, chronic back and neck pain, tachycardia, high cholesterol, clinical depression. Any advice would be wonderful!
title: Daily headaches, dizziness, and severe fatigue
